Entries.Introduction: {{i18n:aideen.introduction}}Good day. I don't believe we have been introduced.#$b#You are the new farmer? Well, you most certainly look the part!#$b#I am Aideen, and it is a pleasure to make your acquantice.$1
Entries.Resort_Leaving: {{i18n:aideen.Resort_Leaving}}%Aideen carefully tucks a small wrapped package into her pocket.#$b#These? They are samples of the local flora.
Entries.Resort_Shore: {{i18n:aideen.Resort_Shore}}These seashells... they are divine!#$b#I could incorporate them into my work, do you not think?
Entries.Resort_Umbrella: {{i18n:aideen.Resort_Umbrella}}It is good to take a break from the sun. I would not wish to get burned.$2
Entries.Resort_Wander: {{i18n:aideen.Resort_Wander}}I do wish to explore... but Willy has cautioned us not to stray too far from the resort.#$b#A pity, for I'm sure this place must be a-bloom with exotic flowers.
Entries.Resort_Bar: {{i18n:aideen.Resort_Bar}}Please, @, join me for a drink.#$b#What am I drinking? It's called a Pink Lady.$1
Entries.Resort: {{i18n:aideen.Resort}It is nice to take a break away from the valley every once in a while.
Entries.Mon: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}It is so peaceful here in East Scarpe, away from those rowdy youths.#$b#Here there is naught but birdsong and the ocean.
Entries.Tue: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Oh hello! Marvelous weather, don't you think?#$b#A fabulous day for reading in the garden, sheltered by the wonderful scent of rose and lavender.
Entries.Wed: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Are you growing flowers on that farm of yours? they shall certainly brighten things up!#$b#I am especially fond of the blue jazz. They add a unique touch to my bouquets.$1
Entries.Thu: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Ah, hello @. You're looking very... rural today.#$b#What is that fragrance you are wearing? Eau de terra? It's... unique.
Entries.Fri: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}The saloon? The stench of beer, a press of crowded bodies... you'd never catch me in there!#$b#No, my idea of a pleasant night is gazing at the stars. Or watching the sun set over the ocean.
Entries.Sat: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}My neighbors? Dr. Jacob is polite but a little reserved, and Eloise... she's so full of questions.
Entries.Sun: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}That appalling fish hawker tried to sell me some of his wares when I went to town the other day!#$b#I couldn't bear that awful smell for even a moment and positively fled in horror.
Entries.danceRejection: {{i18n:aideen.danceRejection}}Dance? With you? Oh, I do not think so.
Entries.divorced: {{i18n:aideen.divorced}}Still desperate for my attention? We are over. Begone!$a
Entries.dumped_Girls: {{i18n:aideen.dumped_Girls}}I have no desire to associate with you and sully my reputation.$a
Entries.breakUp: {{i18n:aideen.breakUp}}It's over? I am hurt, yes. But I expect I shall recover.$s
Entries.Mon2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I hope you do not spend too much time fishing, @.#$b#It is such a barbaric sport, and the aroma is absolutely frightful.$s
Entries.Tue2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}My apologies if I seem short of temper, @.#$b#Baron Munchington procured a mouse last night, and it threw the whole household into utmost chaos!#$b#I barely slept a wink.$2
Entries.Fri2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}It's so peaceful here at night, @. Naught but crickets and the gentle sussuration of the ocean.#$b#I do not miss the hideous racket of traffic noise and sirens one bit.
Entries.Sun2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Oh goodness, hello @. You quite startled me! I was quite lost in my thoughts.
Entries.Wed2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Baron Munchington has proven a fine judge of character, @. Although I worry, sometimes, that his opinion is all too frequently swayed by his appetite.
Entries.Tue4: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Are you growing flowers on your farm @? I would so love a local supplier.
Entries.spring_Sat6: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}The spring flowers are such a delight! Their cheerful colors never fail to make me smile.$1
Entries.Mon8: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I had a suitor once, you know.#$b#In retrospect, we were not well matched, but alas, I was young, and refused to see the truth of it.#$b#I imagined that he might changes his ways for me! A truly preposterous fancy.
Entries.Thu10: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Very well, I admit it. I am no longer repelled by your unique fragrance.#$b#Indeed, I find myself rather drawn to it. Isn't that most peculiar?
Entries.Fri6: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}East Scarpe? I believe it is named such for the escarpment, and the property developer thought the 'e' would add more prestige!#$b#Ridiculous, don't you think? East Shoe!$1
Entries.summer_1: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I hope you are prepared for summer, @. Why, some mornings, it is almost like the tropics!
Entries.summer_Mon: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}You certainly appear to have been working hard today. Might I suggest a dip in the ocean?
Entries.summer_Wed: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Fish for Baron Munchington? Oh no! I would never dream of feeding him carrion; he dines upon the finest kibble.
Entries.summer_Fri: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}This heat has been most unkind to my poor flowers. Look at how their petals wilt!$2
Entries.summer_Sun: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Sunflowers are such cheerful flowers, do you not agree, @?$1
Entries.summer_Wed2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Sometimes I might dip my toes in the ocean, but oh! It is filled with wretched, slimy things.$3
Entries.summer_Tue4: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Have you ventured into the mountains, @?#$b#They are wild and remote but the air is cooler, and the flowers... oh, there are the most exotic blooms!$h
Entries.summer_Sat6: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}This heat is just ghastly! And those accursed flies...$a#$b#I do so look forward to autumn.
Entries.summer_Thu10: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Oh, suddenly I have come over all light-headed. It must be the heat, for I cannot imagine what else might affect me thus.
Entries.fall_Wed: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I apologize if I seem short tempered. My latest delivery arrived... and the poor lillies were crushed!$2#$b#I may be able to salvage them... but oh, I do wish they would handle my precious cargo with more care!
Entries.fall_Thu: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Every Thursday, Dr. Jacob stops by to purchase flowers for his belated wife.#$b#It is so sweet, yet so sad.$2
Entries.fall_Sat: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I do so love fall, don't you, @? The temperature is perfect, and the color? Beautiful!
Entries.fall_Sun6: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Do you enjoy ghost stories, @?#$b#There are rumors, you know, that East Scarpe is haunted. By whom, you ask?$3#$b#Oh! The ghosts of the miners who died here, of course. Lost forever, beneath the unforgiving earth.#$b#Sometimes, when the shadows are long, and the wind rattles in the trees... why, it is all but impossible to not believe it.
Entries.fall_Mon8: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Do you think, perhaps, that Ms. Marnie and Dr. Jacob might make a fine match?#$b#Oh, don't mind me; I've been reading too much and filled my head with fanciful daydreams.
Entries.fall_Thu6: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Dr. Jacob visits his wife once a week, for all that she is departed.#$b#Is that love, do you think, @? Never quite being able to let go?$2
Entries.fall_Thu8: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Have you ever been in love, @? Felt the quickening of your pulse, and a lightness when someone is near?#$b#It is endorsed so frequently in literature, but I fear the reality will prove quite a disappointment.$s
Entries.winter_1: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Winter's blanket has fallen across the land, and the flowers have slipped into hibernation.
Entries.winter_Mon: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Winter is such a dreary time. So monochromatic.#$b#I do miss my floral friends.$2#$b#Friends? Oh, it is merely a fanciful term of phrase, @.#$b#Did you imagine I would consider flowers my friends?$u
Entries.winter_Tue: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}There is something magical about the sunrise in winter, don't you agree, @?#$b#I awoke early, to gather crocuses for a very special bouquet.#$b#And now my toes are quite chilled through.
Entries.winter_Sat4: I do hope that you have not been entertaining the notion of entering those vile caves!$2#$b#So dank, so dreary... and positively overflowing with all manner of terrible fiends!
Entries.winter_Sun8: Today? Oh, I intend to curl up with a cat in my lap and a book in my hands.#$b#Can you think of a better way to spend a dreary winter's day, @?
Entries.winter_Wed2: Have you visited Grampleton at all, @? There is the most splendid clothing emporium.$1
Entries.winter_Thu10: Oh @! This cold bites right to my bones. Would you mind terribly if I huddled with you for warmth?
Entries.spring_12: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I shall be assisting Mrs. Mullner with the flower arrangements for tomorrow.#$b#The Egg Hunt? Oh gracious no! I would never participate in that. It is for the children!
Entries.spring_12_2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}I shall be assisting Mrs. Mullner with the flower arrangements for tomorrow.#$b#The Egg Hunt? Oh gracious no! I would never participate in that. It is for the children!
Entries.spring_23: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Hello @! I cannot possibly stop to chat, for I am most horrendously busy preparing arrangements for the dance tomorrow!#$b#I do hope you shall attend. Though it may be a challenge finding a dance partner. Everyone here is very well matched.
Entries.spring_23_2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Hello @! I cannot chat. I am most horrendously busy preparing arrangements for the dance tomorrow.#$b#I do hope you shall attend. There are many here eager to dance with you.#$e#Me? Oh gracious! Whatever gave you that idea? Begone with you and your impertinence!
Entries.winter_7: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}The ice festival? Oh no, you will not be seeing me there!#$b#The sculptures may be beautiful... but the smell? Gracious no!$3
Entries.winter_7_2: {{i18n:aideen.mon}}Are you trying to persuade me to attend that barbaric festival tomorrow?#$b#No, I shall be warm and cosy with Baron Munchington.
Entries.fall_26: It is Spirit's Eve tomorrow? I find myself with little interest in mocking the supernatural.$3#$b#No, I shall be home, with the Baron and a good book, and all the happier for it.$1
Entries.summer_10: The luau? It is so chaotic! Not like the dinner parties I attended in Grampleton.#$b#Now, those were civilized affairs. None of this potluck nonsense.
Entries.summer_27: Tomorrow the townsfolk gather on the dock to witness the annual migration of the jellies.#$b#I have not yet decided if I shall attend.
Entries.winter_24: Have you received your invitation for the Winter Star event? It is hardly a grand event, but it is not without its charm.$1
Entries.Ai2_1: Oh my, the glass is certainly half full for you, isn’t it? Still, a little optimism will certainly be advantageous for %farm, I do not doubt.
Entries.Ai2_2: Oh, aren’t you Mr. Cynical.^Oh, aren’t you Ms. Cynical.#$b#You’re right, of course. Pelican Town is hardly Paradise Bay.#$b#Yet the peace might be an attraction in itself, don’t you think?
Entries.Ai2_3: Picky?$a#$b#It is no shame, nor crime, to be discerning.#$b#Indeed, it would be most disadvantageous to invite an unruly guest into my house.#$b#On that note, perhaps it is time you should leave, for surely that farm must require your attention.
Entries.Ai2_4: Oh! The gall of you! To listen in on a lady’s private conversation.#$b#Perhaps you should take your nose and poke it into someone else’s business!$a
Entries.rejectNPCA: Why ever would I consider marrying you?$a
Entries.rejectNPCB: Are you teasing me? I have no desire to bind myself to you.$a
Entries.refusal_no_heartsA: Oh! You really are most presumptuous! Begone with you.$a
Entries.engageA: I do not think your betrothed would be well pleased.$a
Entries.marriedA: I do not think your spouse would be well-pleased to hear of your infidelities.$a
Entries.give_flowersA: Oh! These are so beautiful. Of course I shall accept!$4
Entries.give_flowersB: Oh! Yes, I would be delighted to be your date!$4
Entries.give_pendant: You are serious? Why yes, @. I would be honored to be your wife.
Entries.Aideen_102: Next door? Oh, surely not Sterling, he may exude a certain boyish charm, but no, he is barely civilized!$3#$b#Or do you mean Dr Jacob? Hmm... well, he is certainly kind and we have, on occasion, engaged in a rousing discussions of literature and the arts.$1#$b#Also, Baron Munchington is certainly fond of him. But I fear he would regard me as a mere shadow of his wife.$2
Entries.Aideen_103: Why, Mr @!$4^Why Ms @!$4#$b#Are you wishing to court me?$7#$b#Well, you do exude a quaint rural charm.$1^I have never been courted by a lady before! This is most illuminating.$1#$b#And I have certainly grown fond of you. But love? Well, perhaps our tale is a slow burn, rather than a quick spark, yes?$7
Entries.Aideen_104: Baron Munchington is certainly fine company, although he is not noted for his conversation.#$b#And I guess that I hoped I one day might have both.
Entries.Aideen_105: Such a nihilistic perspective, @. I am not sure I appreciate your cynicism. Please, take it elsewhere.
Entries.GiftReaction_Ancient_Flower: Oh! This is a most stunning flower. Wherever did you find it?$4
Entries.GiftReactionCatergory_-80: Thank you! This will look splendid in a bouquet!$1
Entries.GiftReaction_Blue_Jazz: I love this! It adds a most unique touch to any bouquet.$4

Entries.Rainy_Day_0: Oh, this rainy weather is so dreary, don't you agree?$2
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: Sometimes I daydream about going on an adventure. There are exotic flowers on the Fern Islands, you know.
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: Good morning! It was so dull outside, I decided to make you a treat.[223 234 211 651 731]#$e#Something sweet for my sweetheart, yes?$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: Keep warm and dry today, my dear. I don't wish to have to play nursemaid, should you catch a cold!
Entries.Rainy_Day_4: Today feels like a day for day dreaming... and catching up on the latest floral trends.#$b#Take care, my love!$1
Entries.patio_Aideen: Ah, good day, @. There is nothing quite as relaxing - or as inspiring - as a garden.$1
Entries.spouseRoom_Aideen: Good morning, you're looking particularly verdant today... Oh, hello @!#$b#I was just offering my floral friends some encouragement.$4
Entries.Rainy_Day_Aideen: Don't worry about me today, @. The latest issue of 'In Bloom' arrived this morning, and I shall be quite engaged all day!#$b#Stay safe and dry!
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: You're home! Please don't drip all over the floor. Oh, and take those boots off!
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: Sorry if I seem a little distracted tonight.#$b#I have been working all day on a funeral wreath, and it has made me quite melancholic.$2
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: I have been enjoying an astonishing book called 'The Secret Language of Flowers'. Shall we read it together?$1
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: I've recently learned about the Nightwhisper Orchid? It only blossoms when grown next to a partner of the same species. Quite romantic, don't you think?
Entries.Rainy_Night_4: Ah my darling, you're home at last! Dinner is almost cold.[727 231 207 199]$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_5: Oh, apologies for the fragrance of le chat mouille.$2#$b#The Baron took it upon his furry self to indulge in a brief outdoor excursion.$a
Entries.Rainy_Night_Aideen: Ah good, you're back. It has been most frightfully dull around here.#$b#What do you say? Shall we liven things up a little?$4
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: Good morning my darling. I trust you slept well.
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: I awoke early and thought we could enjoy breakfast together.[194 195 210 211 216]$4
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: Did you have nightmares, my dear? You were tossing and turning all night.$2#$b#I was quite wrought with concern!$2
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: Could our cottage be haunted, my dear? I do feel a presence here, watching over us.$2#$b#Oh, do not be alarmed! I am certain it is benign. Perhaps a relative?$1
Entries.Indoor_Day_4: Would you care to stay in and keep me company, my dear?$3#$b#No? Well I love you regardless. Keep safe.$4
Entries.Indoor_Night_Aideen: How was your day, my darling? Fulfilling, I hope?#$b#Me? Oh, I have been arranging bouquets for a wedding.#$b#It has made me feel rather... romantically inclined!$4
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: Ah, @. You're home at last! I had grown quite weary of waiting up for you.$4
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: Please, my darling, do NOT look behind the farmhouse. Baron Munchington and a bird had a... misunderstanding, and the result is.. well, quite unsightly to say the least
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: I have been researching companion planting. It can be most beneficial to plant productivity and pest control.#$b#Perhaps you might be interested?
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: Good evening my darling! Oh, you look weary.#$b#Here, let me light some lavender candles to soothe you off to sleep.$4
Entries.Outdoor_0: I never imagined I would live on a farm... but you know? It is rather more civilized than I had feared.$1
Entries.Outdoor_1: The outside air is so fragrant and fresh. Albeit a little too rural for my taste.$2
Entries.Outdoor_2: %farm is beautiful, @. I never imagined that life as a farmwife could be so delightful.$4
Entries.Outdoor_3: Good morning, my love. Baron Munchington and I engaged in an early morning stroll. I feel most invigorated!$1
Entries.Outdoor_4: Today looks like a glorious day for some foraging, don't you agree?$1
Entries.Outdoor_Aideen: What a glorious day. I fancy I may catch up on a little outdoor reading.
Entries.funLeave_Aideen: It is a most splendid day for a stroll, is it not? Perhaps I shall find some exotic blooms for my creations.
Entries.funReturn_Aideen: Good evening, my dear! Oh, my feet are most weary. Granny Evelyn sent me home with this. [222 234 220 223 223 223]#$b#I informed her you were sweet enough - but she was quite insistent.$1
Entries.OneKid_0: Being a mother is hardly glamorous, although, I must say, it is most rewarding.
Entries.OneKid_1: %kid1 has the most beautiful smile. They will grow up to be quite the charmer, I imagine.$1
Entries.OneKid_2: Perhaps I shall take little %kid1 out for a stroll. One is never too young to learn the language of flowers, after all.$1
Entries.OneKid_3: Poor Baron Munchington, %kid1 has got his fur all ruffled!#$b#He is not yet used to having to share my affection.$3
Entries.TwoKids_1: The children have dined, although I must say, their table manners are most unseemly.$2#$b#Why, I believe Baron Munchington is a more dignified diner!$1
Entries.TwoKids_2: Baron Munchington really seems to love the children. Although %kid1 can be somewhat over-enthusiastic.
Entries.TwoKids_3: There are petals in my hair? Oh, I cannot imagine how they got there!$4#$b#The children and I were pressing flowers. %kid2 displays definite artistic talents. %kid1... well, they make up for it in enthusiasm.$1
Entries.spring_22: Oh! The flower dance is in two days. I must apologise, my love, for I fear I shall be quite overly occupied.$4
Entries.spring_24: I am very much looking forward to dancing with you today.$1#$b#And afterwards? Well, we shall see!$4
Entries.spring_1: Spring has arrived and soon my floral friends will return. Please, I would be deeply appreciative if you would plant these for me. [429][429][429][429][429]
Entries.summer_3: Summer is here, and my orders for wedding arrangements are astronomical!$1#$b#Oh, I'm not complaining, but why would anyone wish to get married in this heat?$3
Entries.summer_15: Poor Baron Munchington is not fond of this weather, and I cannot blame him!$3
Entries.fall_2: These cooler nights are far more pleasant.
Entries.fall_1: Would you be so kind as to plant these seeds for me, @. [425][425][425]
Entries.winter_14: The Night Market shall be in town soon. I wonder what exotic wares we might find!$1
Entries.winter_2: Chilly, isn't it? Perhaps later, we could snuggle together for warmth?$4
Entries.Good_1: My dear! It is simply glorious to see you again. Isn't it peculiar, how I yearn for your presence?$1#$b#I do love you, you know.$4
Entries.Good_2: Good morning, my dear, you look radiant today. Perhaps you could accompany me on a little rendezvous tonight?
Entries.Neutral_0: You are heading out again, my dear? Oh, do not fret about me. Baron Munchington will keep me company.#$b#I shall miss you though.$2
Entries.Neutral_1: What have I been up to today? Oh, nothing of import.$3#$b#How was your day?
Entries.Neutral_6: Oh, apologies my dear. I was quite lost in my thoughts.
Entries.Bad_5: Oh, you have deemed me worthy of conversation today. Do you suspect me to be filled with gratitude?$5
Entries.Bad_6: Farmhouse life is most tedious and I find myself slipping into melancholy.#$b#Oh, don't trouble yourself. I am sure you have more pressing affairs to attend to than your wife.$5
